009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.circle;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.mod;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013
014import java.util.Random;
015
016import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
017import imagingbook.common.geometry.circle.GeometricCircle;
018
019public class CircleSampler {
020        
021        private final Random rg;
022        
023        private final GeometricCircle circle;
024        
025        public CircleSampler(GeometricCircle circle) {
026                this.circle = circle;
027                this.rg = new Random();
028        }
029        
030        public CircleSampler(GeometricCircle circle, long seed) {
031                this.circle = circle;
032                this.rg = new Random(seed);
033        }
034        
035        /**
036         * Generate coordinates of a circular arc using Gaussian noise.
037         * x/y positions are disturbed by additive Gaussian noise.
038         *
039         * @param n          number of points
040         * @param startAngle initial angle (in radians)
041         * @param endAngle   final angle (in radians)
042         * @param sigma      Add noise of intensity 'noise'
043         *
044         * @return an array of sample points
045         */
046        public Pnt2d[] getPoints(int n, double startAngle, double endAngle, double sigma) {
047                double xc = circle.getXc();
048                double yc = circle.getYc();
049                double r = circle.getR();
050
051                
052                Pnt2d[] pts = new Pnt2d[n];
053                
054                startAngle = mod(startAngle, 2 * PI);
055                endAngle = mod(endAngle, 2 * PI);
056                double dAngle = (endAngle >= startAngle) ? 
057                                (endAngle - startAngle) :
058                                (endAngle + 2 * PI - startAngle);
059                
060                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
061                        double alpha = startAngle + dAngle * i / n;
062                        double x = xc + r * Math.cos(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
063                        double y = yc + r * Math.sin(alpha) + sigma * rg.nextGaussian();
064                        pts[i] = Pnt2d.from(x, y);
065                }
066                return pts;
067        }
068

155//
156//
157        public static Pnt2d[] makeTestGander(double s) {
158                Pnt2d[] points = {
159                                Pnt2d.from(s*1, s*7),
160                                Pnt2d.from(s*2, s*6),
161                                Pnt2d.from(s*8, s*8),
162                                Pnt2d.from(s*7, s*7),
163                                Pnt2d.from(s*9, s*5),
164                                Pnt2d.from(s*3, s*7)
165                };
166                return points;
167        }
